intro: Sigmatostalix racemifera, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of red and yellow. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Sigmatostalix racemifera is adapted to cold, arid environments and is often found in alpine meadows.
